intro: Gongylolepis oblanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed gongylolepis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in umbels. Native to southern Africa, this plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. It is often found in rocky soils and can tolerate drought conditions. The plant has a taproot system that helps it survive in nutrient-poor soils.
